title: Ticket #5652: suggested security metaknob
description:
Here is my condor_config common to all hosts 

  use SECURITY:HOST_BASED
  NEMO_SUBNET = 192.168.0.0/21
  ALLOW_READ  = $(NEMO_SUBNET)
  BIND_ALL_INTERFACES = False
  NETWORK_INTERFACE   = 192.168.*
  PRIVATE_NETWORK_NAME      = NEMONET
  PRIVATE_NETWORK_INTERFACE = 192.168.*
  DEFAULT_DOMAIN_NAME  = nemo.phys.uwm.edu
  UID_DOMAIN           = nemo.phys.uwm.edu
  FILESYSTEM_DOMAIN    = nemo.phys.uwm.edu
  CONDOR_HOST = condorcm.nemo.phys.uwm.edu

Some of these aren't strictly security settings. And the only thing I need to do for it to work is to add this to my central manager config: 

  ALLOW_WRITE = $(ALLOW_WRITE) $(NEMO_SUBNET)

You might consider a "security:PRIVATE_NETWORK_HOST_BASED" metaknob that could condense this configuration down to 5 lines: 

  use SECURITY:PRIVATE_NETWORK_HOST_BASED
  PRIVATE_NETWORK = 192.168.0.0/21
  PRIVATE_NETWORK_NAME = NEMONET
  PRIVATE_NETWORK_DOMAIN = nemo.phys.uwm.edu
  CONDOR_HOST = condorcm.nemo.phys.uwm.edu

On the submit node, the metaknob would add 

  ALLOW_READ = $(PRIVATE_NETWORK)
  BIND_ALL_INTERFACES = False
  NETWORK_INTERFACE   = $(PRIVATE_NETWORK)
  PRIVATE_NETWORK_INTERFACE = $(PRIVATE_NETWORK)
  DEFAULT_DOMAIN_NAME  = $(PRIVATE_NETWORK_DOMAIN)
  UID_DOMAIN           = $(PRIVATE_NETWORK_DOMAIN)
  FILESYSTEM_DOMAIN    = $(PRIVATE_NETWORK_DOMAIN)

In principle, you might combine PRIVATE_NETWORK_DOMAIN and PRIVATE_NETWORK_NAME. On the manager node, the metaknob would also add this 

  ALLOW_WRITE = $(ALLOW_WRITE) $(PRIVATE_NETWORK)

You would also need NETWORK_INTERFACE and PRIVATE_NETWORK_INTERFACE to support CIDR notation.
remarks:
2017-Feb-20 14:11:14 by johnkn:
In 8.6, metaknobs allow arguments, and they can be optional So how about something like this: 

use SECURITY : HOST_BASED_PRIVATE_NETWORK(192.168.0.0/21)
or 
use SECURITY : HOST_BASED_PRIVATE_NETWORK(192.168.0.0/21, NEMONET)

which would expand to 

SECURITY : HOST_BASED_PRIVATE_NETWORK metaknob definition
use SECURITY : HOST_BASED
ALLOW_WRITE = $(1) $(ALLOW_WRITE)
ALLOW_READ = $(1)
BIND_ALL_INTERFACES = false
if $(2?)
   PRIVATE_NETWORK_INTERFACE = $(1)
   PRIVATE_NETWORK_NAME = $(2)
   # set this just so that we can easily reference the private network ip range in other config knobs.
   $(2)_SUBNET = $(1)
endif

Perhaps also changing the definition of the HOST_BASED metaknob to 

SECURITY : HOST_BASED metaknob definition
ALLOW_ADMINISTRATOR=$(CONDOR_HOST)
if $(1?)
  ALLOW_OWNER=$(1)
  ALLOW_READ=$(1)
  ALLOW_WRITE=$(1)
  ALLOW_NEGOTIATOR=$(1)
else
  ALLOW_OWNER=$(FULL_HOSTNAME) $(IPV4_ADDRESS) $(IPV6_ADDRESS)
  ALLOW_READ=*
  ALLOW_WRITE=$(FULL_HOSTNAME) $(IPV4_ADDRESS) $(IPV6_ADDRESS)
  ALLOW_NEGOTIATOR=$(CONDOR_HOST)
endif
ALLOW_NEGOTIATOR_SCHEDD=$(ALLOW_NEGOTIATOR) $(FLOCK_NEGOTIATOR_HOSTS)
ALLOW_WRITE_COLLECTOR=$(ALLOW_WRITE) $(FLOCK_FROM)
ALLOW_WRITE_STARTD=$(ALLOW_WRITE) $(FLOCK_FROM)
ALLOW_READ_COLLECTOR=$(ALLOW_READ) $(FLOCK_FROM)
ALLOW_READ_STARTD=$(ALLOW_READ) $(FLOCK_FROM)
